WRITING.TITLE: I found my old food diary.
WRITING.TEXT:
I had this food diary around the time I reached my lowest adult weight (111) in September 2014. My eating back then seemed so effortless, and so non-ED, but I was able to get to that low weight. My therapist made me keep this food diary so she could keep track of my eating since I was losing so rapidly.
On average, I would have coffee and a cigarette in the morning, a sandwich thin with a few ounces of sliced chicken and some bagel crisps for lunch (350 calories maybe?), and for "dinner", I would have a protein bar or hummus + pita or apples + peanut butter (about 200-300 calories). Anyways, this whole thing is so surreal. I know getting into a friends with benefits type relationship will be a bad idea, considering she broke my heart and we both have eating disorders. But as far as we're both concerned, we are both recovered. When we dated we had no problems going to lunches and dinners together and we were comfortable eating with each other. Sometimes she would comment on how little I ate, but I'm like half a foot shorter than her and I never intentionally under-ate around her.
I just wanted to get that out there. It's so damn weird. We broke up over a year and a half ago and I never imagined she'd ever want something like this. She always prided herself on being interested in serious relationships only and was super against casual dating, hook ups and stuff like that. I mean I guess it's different since we know each other and we would be spending time together as friends as well, but still...

Are you still actively trying to lose weight? In her mind, your behavior may be triggering to her. Of course you're doing a good thing for yourself by eating healthy and exercising, and I'm not saying you should stop that. Do you talk to her about what you eat or how you exercise? If so, that's possibly triggering to her and it may be best to avoid diet/exercise topics with her.

It's honestly much easier for me to skip breakfast. I never wake up hungry but within 3 or so hours I'll be hungry. If I push through and let the hunger pass, I don't feel the need to eat until like 3pm. The only time I force myself to eat something small is if I'm riding my horse in the morning. So yeah basically I do IF without thinking about it too much. Most of my calories come between 3pm and 5pm. I don't like to eat too close to bedtime because I like going to sleep with my stomach concave. If I do get hungry a few hours before bedtime, I just have something light like fruit or yoghurt.
(I'm Indian) and oh crap I did this once with my mom's chicken years ago and it was brutal. Never again.

I just eat small pre-portioned snacks throughout the day, and I eat them really slowly. I try to prep little snack baggies on Sundays to take to campus with me. Usually I have little baggies filled with 100 calories worth of mini pretzel crisps, and 3 oz of fruits and veggies (raspberries, blueberries, baby carrots, etc.). I try to make each baggie last at least an hour. I also take 2 sips of water in between each bite. I must look like a freak eating my small snacks in class, one at a time, with all that water, spending an hour eating such a small quantity of food. But it prevents me from being ravenous when I get home in the evening.

UGH I had a 6 oz filet mignon and steak is *already* something my stomach takes ages to process. Probably not the best idea for my first real meal in over 2 weeks. I think I should be able to get a laxative. There will be one instance today where I'm out of the house alone, so it could work. Laxative tea would be pretty risky as my mom and her boyfriend spend a lot of time around the kitchen - I don't want them to see that!
Any laxative you suggest? I don't think I've taken a laxative since I was 18.

WRITING.TITLE: I ate so much I'm going to die.
WRITING.TEXT:
Okay so I'm not going to *die* but I kinda feel like that blueberry girl from Willy Wonka The Chocolate Factory.
So my mom and her boyfriend took me out to dinner yesterday. I honestly feel like I ate an entire month's worth of calories in 1 meal. On the bright side, I don't feel as fat as I thought I would feel. My collar bones are still prominent and even though I'm still bloated and look kinda pregnant, I can feel/see my ribs and hip bones. The 2 glasses of wine I drank last night might have dehydrated me a bit? I haven't had alcohol in almost 4 weeks.
But I'm so disgusted with myself and bloated from last night that I feel like I'll never be able to eat again. How does one eat that much food? I'm terrified of weighing myself today. I also have not been able to use the toilet in like 2 days so that definitely won't help what the scale says. I don't have any laxatives and my stomach is in knots :/ even coffee isn't helping.
Blah I really wish my mom wasn't going to cook this weekend. I think I'm just going to have to (try to) fast all day again and wait for ~~death~~ dinner.
I hope you all have a lovely weekend.
Edit: I have diuretics but I feel like that would be pointless? I didn't drink much yesterday besides the 2 glasses of wine, but alcohol dehydrates you already, right? But I did eat a lot of high sodium foods so hmm maybe it would be worth a shot.
Yeah I also think cream cheese on saltines is pretty tasty. The cream cheese I buy is 35 cal per tablespoon but saltines are so damn calorie dense.
I dip these mini pretzel crisps in plain non-fat Greek yogurt. It sounds sooo bland but the taste is actually very satisfying and unique.
Thank you :3 yes his nose is super soft!

I don't exercise when I fast (I do coffee fasts so it's up to you whether you'd consider that a real fast or not) but I do ride my horse. Riding elevates my heart rate and causes me to break a sweat but nothing compared to what cardio on an elliptical does. At the most, I'll do bodyweight training and lifting when I'm fasting, but even that gets me feeling really lightheaded and physically unstable.

Drink a lot of coffee and smoke cigarettes if you get hungry
Unfortunately, yes. I quit smoking about a year ago (and gained a fuck ton of weight). Since my ED came back a few weeks ago, I've started smoking again. It makes coffee fasts so much more bearable. I've had 3 or 4 packs of cigarettes in the last 2 weeks and fortunately, I haven't become nicotine dependent again. I can't smoke because my mom and her boyfriend are visiting and I've had no nicotine withdrawals (so far). However I think I'll only smoke on coffee fast days to ensure I don't get addicted again.
I'm the opposite. 2 mornings ago my heart rate was 144 when I woke up from fasting the day before.

Baby steps! I have a keyhole gap right now which I haven't had in well over a year. It really motivates me to keep going.
Also, congrats!

Seconding what /u/silverdiscipline said. I weigh myself every day. I was heavily restricting when I got my period recently so it was super frustrating to see my weight stall and move very slowly (as far as I saw on the scale, I didn't gain weight, but I was losing very slowly and was stuck at the same weight for 3 days until I bit the bullet and fasted).

Thank you for this. Luckily I have school all day so I can "fast" until I have to come home to whatever my mom has planned for dinner. I'm spending my lunch break on campus walking for 1 hour 45 min so I'm sure that'll help me feel better, too. Thank you again 3
However, the rest of the weekend will be difficult since I don't have class on Fridays :3 I guess I just have to mentally prepare myself for the number on the scale come Monday. I'll probably just coffee fast on Monday to get rid of all the excess water weight.

Hello! I am a Hunter/Eq rider. I also do a bit of Dressage here and there but the Dressage is mainly to supplement my jumping and equitation.
I bought my horse when I was 21 in October 2014. At the time, my horse helped me recover from my eating disorder. I was riding more often since I had my own horse and could ride as much as I wanted to, and I was too busy taking care of him (farrier, chiro, vet appointments, etc.) to focus on not eating. I mean, my eating wasn't exactly consistent. There would be days where I would eat well over my TDEE, days where I wouldn't eat at all (because I was too busy) and days where I'd eat only one meal consisting of whatever I wanted. But I was somehow able to maintain a relatively comfortable weight ranging between 115 and 118 despite not counting calories. However within ~6 months I quit smoking which caused me to gain weight.
I personally do not know any other riders with ED's. I think in the Equitation world specifically, riders are overly scrutinized if they aren't tall and a size 00. I'm very short so I feel like I have to overcompensate with skinniness. None of my trainers have ever put pressure on me to be skinnier, but I look at all the pretty skinny riders who look amazing in their breeches and get sad about myself.
I want to look like one of those beautiful, tall, lanky Maclay girls. I never thought I'd relapse after buying my horse, who is like a child to me, because rationally I know I need fuel to be the best rider I can be. But wanting to look like one of those blue ribbon winning Eq girls has brought my ED back, unfortunately.
OH and since you want to hear about our horses: Mine is an 18 year old dark bay OTTB who's 15.2hh. [He's a real cutie cutie](http://imgur.com/a/bH1Jg). We showed 2"0 and 2"3 Hunter/Eq stuff last year and did our first rated show AND placed 2nd, 2nd and 3rd! This year we're showing 2"6 with plans to do maybe 2 rated shows. REALLY hoping to go to Thermal in January.
Yes I am! OH GOD so in real life AND on this sub I'm known as the crazy horse obsessed girl lmaooo

WRITING.TITLE: I feel disgusting.
WRITING.TEXT:
My mom and her boyfriend arrived last night. They brought food on their way home from the airport and I had some - exactly 14 fries and 5 chicken nuggets. But I'm up 1.4 pounds today.
**1.4 pounds!!**
I know it's water weight and I haven't used the toilet yet but I feel so disgusting. I don't even want to think about what the scale will say on Monday morning once they're gone.
Last night when I got into bed, I had so much anxiety about what I had eaten. My heart was racing, I couldn't sleep and I could *feel* myself gaining weight. Clearly I wasn't wrong.

"You can eat a lot as long as you exercise a lot too! Then you'll never get fat!"
UGH! Once I ate a whole lot of pizza and I was telling my gf at the time how gross I felt/how much I regretting eating it/how I'll get fat and she said "well why don't you just work it off at the gym tomorrow?"
You can't outrun your fork!

I'll definitely try that with the potatoes. She makes chicken curry, too, so I can scrape the curry part off and just eat the chicken.
And I will definitely post once they've left! Ugh they already had me eat fries today and I can *feel* the weight gain.
:D thank you so much!
Hello friend!

Yeah. I had such an amazing lesson this morning which really pumped me up for this weekend...then a few hours ago my trainer texted saying it was cancelled.
I'm actually supposed to be going out to dinner with a friend tonight who knows about my ED stuff. It's more like, hookah and chill rather than dinner, but if she eats and I don't, I'll feel really bad. I have no idea what I'm going to do tonight.
And yeah on average I'm at like 500 cals/day with 2-3 days of fasting every week. I don't really eat meals, just small stuff throughout the day. Hopefully my stomach cooperates. Maybe tonight with my friend I can *try* to eat dinner to see how my stomach feels. That way, if I do get sick, I can just tell my mom in the morning that the restaurant food made me sick. But I don't know. The though of eating an actual meal scares me so much :/

Hmm. Usually she curries or pan fries the potatoes, so I could ask her to curry the potatoes, that way I can scrape the curry off at pick at the potato. With eggs she likes to fry them but I can ask her to use cooking spray or something instead + egg whites only. I only eat egg whites anyways so hopefully she understands.

Yeah I could definitely say my appetite is off because I'm sad about the show being cancelled. I did tell my mom I was trying to lose weight though diet and exercise (aka the healthy, normal way) but I have lost a bit too much weight for the time period I said I started dieting and exercising. But I'll just reiterate to her that I've been going hard at the gym and riding more. Thank you for your support 3 I'll also try to see what I can get away with. WRITING.TITLE: My horse show got cancelled :(
WRITING.TEXT:
It's going to rain heavily this weekend so the show has been cancelled. My mom and her boyfriend are supposed to be flying down for it. I texted my mom saying it got cancelled and she hasn't replied. I don't know if she'll still come if it's cancelled, but I'm 80% sure she'll still come.
ED wise, this will take a huge toll on me. I already was expecting that I'd eat a lot since my mom will be here cooking and stuff, but now that I'm not showing, I'll be spending more time with her and her boyfriend, meaning it'll be almost impossible to skip out on meals. My initial plan when the show was still on was to say I'm too nervous in the morning to eat breakfast, hang out at the show and not eat while her and her boyfriend go out and do stuff in the afternoon, then pick at whatever dinner she makes.
But now I'll be around them for all 3 meals. Sigh. I feel like such a horrible person for being upset about having my wonderful, loving mother around for 4 days.
I'm particularly worried about the first meal I'll have with them. I haven't had an actual meal in over 2 weeks so I don't know how my body will respond. If I get sick from it, my mom will be highly suspicious about how I've been eating lately. It doesn't help that she'll see I've lost weight and already be suspicious about that.
Have any of you experienced any physical issues with eating a meal after restricting for a long time?
